loop_edges: Core Developer -> Implicit Knowledge Transfer (Mentorship) -> Promotion Rate -> Core Developer
description: More core developers increase mentorship, accelerating the promotion of new core developers. This reinforcing loop creates exponential growth in the core team's size and capacity.
citation_title: Socialization in Open Source Software Projects: A Growth Mixture Modeling Approach
citation_relevance: Examines how socialization processes including mentorship lead to core developer status in OSS projects

loop_edges: Core Developer -> Implicit Knowledge Transfer (Mentorship) -> Skill up -> Experienced Contributors -> Promotion Rate -> Core Developer
description: Core developers mentor others, increasing the skilled contributor pool and accelerating promotions. This reinforcing loop amplifies the project's overall experience and development velocity over time.
citation_authors: Faraj, S., Jarvenpaa, S. L., et al.
citation_relevance: Documents how knowledge transfer through mentoring increases collective capability and project velocity

loop_edges: Experienced Contributors -> Promotion Rate -> Experienced Contributors
description: A higher promotion rate depletes the pool of experienced contributors, which in turn slows the promotion rate. This balancing loop seeks equilibrium in the contributor hierarchy.
citation_relevance: Describes the natural hierarchy and promotion dynamics in OSS projects where core developers emerge from contributors

loop_edges: New Contributors -> Skill up -> New Contributors
description: As new contributors gain skills, they leave the 'new' pool, slowing the overall skill-up rate. This balancing loop regulates the growth of inexperienced contributors.

loop_edges: Core Developer -> Developer's Turnover -> Core Developer
description: An increase in core developers leads to higher turnover, which then reduces the number of core developers. This balancing loop stabilizes the core team size against attrition.
